sentence.Network_en: These days he is ferociously competitive.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些天来他极其争强好胜。

sentence.Network_en: He trapped Conn in a corner and pummeled him ferociously for thirty seconds.
sentence.Network_cn: 他将康恩逼进一个角落，用拳头暴打了他半分钟。

list.abs: 形容音乐家乐队动物的形容词(英文)_百度知道 ... 一头凶猛的狮子 a ferocious lion 凶猛的野兽 ferocious animals 凶猛的 fierce.
用英语怎么说_百度知道 ... head ball 顶球 ferocious tackle 拼抢 block 堵截.
Some ferocious animal has devoured him ., 有恶兽把他吃了 , 约瑟被撕碎了!
猛兽(ferocious beast):更有效对付轻甲部队复仇女妖(chaos furies):易受魔法打击(vulnerable to magic):害怕魔法,包括法术(spell)和.

entry.def: A ferocious animal, person, or action is very fierce and violent.

example.ex: The police had had to deal with some of the most ferocious violence ever seen on the streets of London.
example.tran: 警方不得不去处理伦敦街头发生的一些极其严重的暴力事件。

entry.tran: (战争、争论等冲突)激烈的，猛烈的，酷烈的
entry.def: A ferocious war, argument, or other form of conflict involves a great deal of anger, bitterness, and determination.

example.ex: A ferocious battle to select a new parliamentary candidate is in progress.
example.tran: 推选一位新的议会候选人的激战正酣。

entry.def: If you describe actions or feelings as ferocious, you mean that they are intense and determined.

example.ex: Lindbergh was startled at the ferocious depth of anti-British feeling.
example.tran: 反英情绪之深之烈令林德伯格大为震惊。

auth_sentence.content: His eyes gleamed ferociously behind his glasses.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: His eyes gleamed ferociously behind his glasses.

auth_sentence.content: Be careful - the wood-ear mushrooms can pop and splutter quite ferociously.
auth_sentence.res_content: Be careful - the wood-ear mushrooms can pop and splutter quite ferociously.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Be careful - the wood-ear mushrooms can pop and splutter quite ferociously.

auth_sentence.content: We won't see anybody who will go at it as ferociously.
